messages.title: Building a stronger economy and a fairer society.
messages.content: Creating opportunity for everyone. James Harrison and the Liberal Democrats are committed to building a stronger economy and a fairer society - for everyone, by balancing the books and investing in services for a stronger economy, and by providing opportunity for everyone by investing in education.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to balancing the books and investing in services for a stronger economy.
Providing opportunity for everyone by investing in education.
Lib Dem plan to boost health spending, increasing budgets by £400m a year by 2021.

mentions.candidate: James lives in Penrith and currently works as an Analyst at Parker Fitzgerald.
mentions.partyLeader: Pictured with Norse Glasgow Region Member
mentions.tacticalSituation: In the 2010 and 2014 election, Glasgow North West had one of the highest Lib Dem votes in the west of Scotland.

issues.economy: Commitment to building a stronger economy.
issues.education: Investing in education for providing opportunity.
issues.health: Boost health spending by £400 million a year by 2021.

leaflet.personalStatement: James is one of the generation of 'liberal politicians new to Westminster' mentioned in your newspaper.

politicalExperience.achievements: Works on high level analysis of the UK's biggest banks.

quotes.text: 'James is one of the generation of 'liberal politicians new to Westminster' mentioned in your newspaper. I share the local criticisms of cuts to local services - including the threat to the cardiovascular unit at Gartnavel hospital.'

images.caption: James Harrison pictured with party member.
Graphical representation of budget priorities concerning tax cuts and increases.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The flyer urges to vote for James Harrison as the 'strongest voice for Glasgow North West'. It mentions the Lib Dem plan for Britain and highlights that James Harrison has been endorsed by the 'newspaper' as part of the generation of new liberal politicians.
